title: MESCIUS DOC MCP
subtitle: MCP Server For Developer Components of MESCIUS
description: Follow the instructions below to configure the MCP service in your AI client

copilot.title: Configure GitHub Copilot MCP in VS Code
steps: Ensure GitHub Copilot and GitHub Copilot Chat extensions are installed
Latest VS Code has MCP support enabled by default, no additional setup required
copilot.note: You can configure MCP servers in two ways: Workspace Configuration (Recommended) or Command Palette.
copilot.addDesc: Create a .vscode/mcp.json file in your project root:
copilot.altTitle: Using the MCP: Add Server Command
altSteps: Type "MCP: Add Server" and select the command
Provide a name for the server (e.g. spreadjs-mcp, gcexcel-mcp)
copilot.usageTitle: Using MCP Tools with GitHub Copilot
usageSteps: Open Copilot Chat in VS Code (click the Copilot icon in the activity bar)
Switch to Agent mode from the chat dropdown menu
Click the Tools (ðŸ”§) button to view available MCP tools
copilot.manageTip: Use the "MCP: List Servers" command to view and manage your configured servers: Start/Stop/Restart servers, view server logs, browse available tools.

cursor.title: Configure MCP in Cursor
steps: Press <kbd>Shift+Command+J</kbd> (Mac) or <kbd>Shift+Ctrl+J</kbd> (Windows/Linux) to open Cursor settings
Look for "MCP & Integrations" in the left sidebar
Click "+ New MCP Server"
cursor.note: This will open the mcp.json file, which you need to edit.
cursor.addDesc: Copy the configuration below and paste it under the mcpServers key in the mcp.json file.

windsurf.title: Configure MCP in Windsurf
steps: Open Windsurf editor
Go to Settings â†’ Extensions â†’ MCP
Click "Add Server"
windsurf.addDesc: Copy the configuration below and add it to MCP settings.

cline.title: Configure MCP in Cline
steps: Open Cline extension in VS Code
Click the settings icon
Find the "MCP Servers" configuration
cline.note: Cline supports adding MCP servers via UI or config file.
cline.addDesc: Add the following configuration to Cline's MCP settings.

claudedesktop.title: Configure MCP in Claude Desktop
steps: Open Claude Desktop app
Go to Settings â†’ Developer â†’ Edit Config
Edit the claude_desktop_config.json file
claudedesktop.note: Claude Desktop config file only supports stdio transport. Remote HTTP servers require the mcp-remote bridge (npx mcp-remote). Alternatively, add remote servers via Settings â†’ Integrations in the UI.
claudedesktop.addDesc: Add the following configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. This uses mcp-remote to bridge the HTTP connection:

codex.title: Configure MCP in OpenAI Codex CLI
steps: Install Codex CLI: npm install -g @openai/codex
Create or edit config file at ~/.codex/config.toml (global) or .codex/config.toml (project)
codex.note: Codex CLI uses TOML format for configuration, not JSON. The JSON config shown below is for reference â€” use the TOML format in your config file.
codex.addDesc: Add the following to your config.toml file. Note: Codex uses TOML format with [mcp_servers.name] sections and endpoint field.

jetbrains.title: Configure MCP in JetBrains IDE
steps: Open JetBrains IDE (IntelliJ IDEA, WebStorm, PyCharm, etc.)
Go to Settings/Preferences â†’ Tools â†’ AI Assistant â†’ MCP Servers
Click the "+" button to add a new server
jetbrains.note: Requires AI Assistant plugin installed with MCP support enabled. Some older IDE versions may not support MCP.
jetbrains.addDesc: Add the following server information in MCP Servers configuration.

lobechat.title: Configure MCP in LobeChat
steps: Open LobeChat app or web version
Go to Settings â†’ Language Model â†’ MCP
Click "Add MCP Server"
lobechat.note: LobeChat is an open-source multi-model AI client with MCP support. Visit LobeHub MCP Marketplace to discover more MCP services.
lobechat.addDesc: Add the following configuration to LobeChat's MCP settings.

other.title: Universal MCP Integration
other.intro: This service only supports Streamable HTTP protocol. Choose the MCP endpoint based on the product you are using:
other.spreadjsDesc: For SpreadJS JavaScript spreadsheet component documentation:
other.gcexcelDesc: For GcExcel server-side Excel component documentation:
other.forguncyDesc: For Forguncy low-code platform plugin SDK documentation:
other.wynDesc: For Wyn embedded business intelligence documentation:
steps: Locate MCP Settings in your application (look for "MCP", "Model Context Protocol", or "Tools")
Choose Streamable HTTP as the transport method
Configure connection using one of the patterns above
Restart your application and verify the server appears in available tools
troubleItems: Connection Issues: Verify the server URL is accessible, ensure network connectivity
Tool Discovery: Ensure the client supports MCP capabilities, check configuration file syntax
Protocol Issues: This service only supports Streamable HTTP protocol, SSE or stdio are not supported
